name: Tool Handle
description: The tool handle is used for making the Flimsy Shovel and the Flimsy Pickaxe. The tool handle cannot be found in Inmates' desks, looted off of Inmates, or be sold by inmates. The only way to acquire this is to craft it (but it can be purchased in the Escapists 2). It is called "Makeshift Handle" on console/mobile.

name: Flimsy Pickaxe
description: A Flimsy Pickaxe can be used for removing stones or walls. It is a Lightweight Pickaxe but to the lesser extent. It’s made using a crowbar, a tool handle, and duct tape. It is usually used for crafting a Lightweight Pickaxe as it will easily break, wasting the materials used to make it.

name: Lightweight Pickaxe
description: The Lightweight Pickaxe is used for digging through stone, walls, and dirt. It’s the standard for most wall breakouts. If it's about to break, it is recommended to upgrade it to a Sturdy Pickaxe instead, since that will restore its durability. The Escapists 2: Used in: The Escapists 2:

name: Sturdy Pickaxe
description: Used for digging. This can be repaired using a Roll of Duct Tape and Timber on the PC version. It can be used to make a Multitool. This uses up 3% per use. This tool is mainly crafted. It can also be found in a Prisoner Stash, and rewarded for a certain Favour in The Escapists 2. Crafted with the following recipe: The Escapists 2: Used in: The Escapists 2:

name: Flimsy Shovel
description: The Flimsy Shovel is the first tier (Tier I) level of the different types of shovels. It can be used to dig holes in the ground and tunnel through the dirt, or chip away at walls. They will dig 84% of a single square hole.

name: Lightweight Shovel
description: The Lightweight Shovel is a better version of the Flimsy Shovel. It can be obtained by crafting.

name: Sturdy Shovel
description: The Sturdy Shovel is a better version of the Lightweight Shovel. It loses 2% of durability per use. As such, it has a total of 50 uses before breaking. It can be repaired using a Roll of Duct Tape and Sheet of Metal on the PC version. It can be obtained in a Prisoner Stash or by crafting with the following recipe: The Escapists 2: Used in: The Escapists 2:

name: Flimsy Cutters
description: Flimsy Cutters are used to cut vents, slats, and fences. It can also be crafted into Lightweight Cutters, an improved version of Flimsy Cutters. It appears in The Escapists, The Escapists: The Walking Dead and The Escapists 2. Flimsy Cutters can be crafted with the following recipe: The Escapists 2: Used in: The Escapists 2:

name: Lightweight Cutters
description: Lightweight Cutters are used to cut vents, slats, and fences. It is an improved version of the Flimsy Cutters and can be crafted into Sturdy Cutters. It appears in both The Escapists and The Escapists: The Walking Dead. Lightweight Cutters can be crafted with the following recipe: The Escapists 2: Used in: The Escapists 2:

name: Sturdy Cutters
description: The Sturdy Cutters are a tool that appears in The Escapists, The Escapists: The Walking Dead, and The Escapists 2. Used to cut Slats and fences, being the best cutting tool in the game. Also a fairly strong weapon in TE2. The Escapists 2:

name: Multitool
description: The Multi-Tool is the best digging/chipping tool in The Escapists and The Escapists 2. The Multitool is 5/5 for both digging and chipping. Like a Sturdy Pickaxe it takes 5 uses on a wall to chip through (20% per successful chip), and can rapidly destroy rocks and walls. Digging dirt underground takes 3 uses on a dirt space to clear it (33% on each dirt space, 50% per dig in TE2, meaning 2 hits), just like a Sturdy Shovel, and 5 uses to dig a hole up or down (20% per dig, also 50% per dig in TE2, also 2 hits). The Multitool only degrades 1% per use (5% in TE2). It is capable of digging 33 dirt spaces underground (10 in TE2) or chipping through 20 wall blocks (10 in TE2, verify). There is no way to repair or upgrade a Multitool, so a larger operation will require entirely new tools. This item can only be obtained by crafting and is never found in inmates' desks or sold by inmates. It cannot be found in a Prisoner Stash. The Escapists 2:

name: Cutting Floss
extra_info: Can not be used as a weapon in TE2
description: The Cutting Floss is used to cut vents, slats, and fences. It can cut one obstacle without breaking. (TE1)

name: Powered Screwdriver
extra_info: Currently not on the Console, exclusive to TE1
description: A powered screwdriver is a special tool that allows you to unscrew a Vent Cover or break through slats in the vents. Using a powered screwdriver will allow you to get a Vent Cover upon fully unscrewing a vent cover, which you can place back on an open vent with 5% durability. You can then easily use the screwdriver to take it down again with one use. This allows you to access vents without the need to use a Fake Vent Cover. The alternative of using a file, Plastic Knife or Flimsy Cutters to break into a vent will not give you back the original cover, forcing you to craft a fake vent cover to avoid being sent to solitary if a guard spots the open vent. Although you can pick up and place a fake vent cover without the need for a tool, it has limited durability, and will break with repeated use. You can repeatedly unscrew and replace the original vent cover as long as your screwdriver holds up. Be careful not to use your screwdriver up after placing down the vent cover and getting yourself stuck in the vents or block yourself out of the vents. If this happens, since the vent cover will only have 5% durability after being placed back down it can easily be cut with another tool in the event of an emergency, but then the vent cover will be destroyed and you will need to replace it with a fake vent cover.

name: Comb Shiv
description: The Comb Shiv appears in all three Escapists games as a weak, but cheap to make melee weapon.

name: Toothbrush Shiv
description: The Toothbrush Shiv is used for beating up other characters in the game. It is the same as having a Comb Shiv. It can also be asked in certain favours. However, the Toothbrush Shiv is not recommended as a weapon due to its extremely low stats. Several non-contraband weapons (many are available in The Escapists 2) have the same stats as this, making it obsolete. The Toothbrush Shiv is one of the easiest weapons to get, as it can be "crafted" simply by using a Toothbrush on any wall. It can also be obtained from inmate's inventories once you've beat them up.

name: Comb Blade
description: The Comb Blade has only one use; beating up other inmates or guards. It is a 2/5 weapon, making it as strong as the Comb Shiv, Toothbrush Shiv, and the Broom. In The Escapists 2, it is also required in Favours. Because the Comb Blade is a relatively weak weapon, it's recommended to use a Comb Shiv instead (or considerably better, a non-contraband weapon such as a Broom), and to save the Razor Blade for making a stronger weapon, such as a Whip or a Knuckle Duster. In The Escapists 2, the Comb Blade is virtually useless, as its stats are identical to those of the Razorblade used to craft it, while the Razor is also non-contraband. As such, it is recommended that you never craft the Comb Blade (unless you're doing it for a favour).  It can be found on inmates, rarely in their desks or crafted. The Escapists 2:

name: Sock Mace
description: Can be used as a weapon to beat up characters. Sometimes found in inmates pockets or can be crafted with the following recipes: The Escapists 2: This weapon is very easy to obtain. It also has low Intelligence required to craft. However, it is weaker than most Weapons, so consider better alternatives.
stats_in_2:
Damage: Low
Speed: High
Range: Low

name: Super Sock Mace
description: Can be used to beat up other inmates and guards in game.
stats_in_2:
Damage: Medium
Speed: High
Range: Low

name: Wooden Bat
description: This is the item for The Escapists and The Escapists 2 to see the item in The Escapists: The Walking Dead visit Baseball Bat
stats_in_2:
Damage: Medium
Speed: Medium
Range: Medium

name: Spiked Bat
description: This is the item for The Escapists to see the item in The Escapists: The Walking Dead visit Nailed Spiked Bat
stats_in_2:
Damage: High
Speed: Medium
Range: Medium

name: Super Baseball Bat
description: This is the item for The Escapists to see the item in The Escapists: The Walking Dead visit Nailed Spiked Bat
stats_in_2:
Damage: High
Speed: Low
Range: High

name: Glass Shank
description: The Glass Shank has only one use; to beat up other inmates and guards. Occasionally, an Inmate will wield this weapon. These inmates can deal a significant amount of damage (especially with a high strength stat), so watch out! A Glass Shank can be obtained by crafting or looting other Inmates & Guards that have them. NOTE: While this weapon is only available on the PC version of The Escapists, it can be obtained on all versions of The Escapists 2. The Escapists 2:

name: Knuckle Duster
description: The Knuckle Duster is a weapon that does not require many materials. It has a damage stat of 4/5 in The Escapists, making it a high-tier weapon. It is crafted, but can be found on knocked out inmates as well. In The Escapists 2, it is not very strong, but can be upgraded to a Super Knuckle Duster. Obtained by crafting and knocked out inmates. The Escapists: The Escapists 2:

name: Nunchucks
description: One of many weapons obtainable in the game, it has the same attack damage as the whip in the first The Escapists game (both 5/5). It is also required for the "Way of the Dragon" achievement in the first The Escapists game. In The Escapists 2, it is as powerful as an ordinary Metal Baton, making it a higher-end weapon. It is a Melee weapon capable for both stealth and face to face combat. Timber and wire are both relatively easy items to find, and are much more useful when combined into nunchucks.

name: Whip
description: The Whip is a weapon in both The Escapists and The Escapists 2. The whip is one of the most powerful weapons in the Escapists, doing 5/5 damage. In The Escapists 2, the whip was significantly nerfed and is now inferior to the Baton or Crowbar. However, the whip in The Escapists 2 can be used to craft a Super Whip, which is one of the strongest conventional weapons available. The primary method of obtaining this weapon is crafting. In The Escapists, you can find it in other inmate's drawers or in their pockets, but it is nearly impossible after a certain update. In The Escapists 2, inmates may sometimes wield this weapon. The Whip is also used in the following recipe:
stats_in_2:
Damage: Medium
Speed: Low
Range: Medium

name: Super Whip
description: The super whip is a powerful and dangerous weapon, obtainable through favors or crafting. It constitutes, with the Super Metal Baton, the highest tier of conventional weapons in the game. This weapon is arguably easier to craft, as beating up a riot guard is not required. It is required in certain Favours. You are also required to craft the Super Whip to complete the favour "Rock Hammer Hard Place" and get the Rock Hammer in Fort Tundra. The crafting recipe can be obtained from paying 50 coins to the payphones at Area 17.
stats_in_2:
Damage: High
Speed: Medium
Range: High

name: Cup of Molten Chocolate
description: The cup of molten chocolate is a one-time use item that can be used to incapacitate inmates and guards in one hit. However, it cannot instantly knock out a SWAT guard, as they will simply take high damage but survive. Select it in your inventory and strike a target as normal to KO them. However, using this item on a person will immediately drop their OPN to its minimum as well and once the inmate or guard wakes up, they'll try to beat you up. This is the only way to knock out someone who has a Stun Rod. One thing to note is that when crafted on console (Xbox, Playstation) it will be just be called Molten Chocolate, as opposed to a cup of it. It is also called a Cup of Molten Choc in The Escapists 2. The Escapists  There are many weapons similar to this item. These include the following: The Escapists Cracker, a weapon unique to the DLC prison Santa's Sweatshop. This weapon does not complete a beatdown Favour. Bomb Surprise, Flamethrower, Sharp Tea Tray and Garotting Wire Watch, exclusive to the DLC prison Duct Tapes Are Forever. The Escapists 2 Makeshift Stungun, a crafted weapon that lasts 4 or 5 hits before breaking Cattle Prod, a crafted weapon, exclusive to Rattlesnake Springs, which is identical in function to the Makeshift Stungun Stungun, identical in function to the Makeshift Stungun. Purchasable from Inmates in U.S.S. Anomaly, found on the roof of the multiplayer-only area in H.M.P Offshore.
stats_in_2:
Damage: Maximum
Speed: Medium
Range: Medium

name: Makeshift Double Bass
description: The Makeshift Double Bass is an item in The Escapists 2. Used mostly for favours, it also serves as a weak weapon.

name: Makeshift Sledgehammer
description: The Makeshift Sledgehammer is a contraband weapon in The Escapists 2 that does a strong amount of damage. The Makeshift Sledgehammer is powerful but has a slow attack speed. It is recommended that you back off after attacking or block to hold off attacks before the attack recharges. It can be requested as part of the "Beat the Bully" favour.  Its high range can also give you an edge over guards, as their batons have medium range, allowing you to hit them from out of their reach if you play it well.

name: Makeshift Cosh
description: The Makeshift Cosh is one of the items in the game The Escapists The Walking Dead. Also appears in The Escapists 2.
stats_in_2:
Damage: Low
Speed: High
Range: Low

name: Makeshift Spear
description: The Makeshift Spear has only one use; to beat up other inmates and guards. Occasionally, an Inmate will wield this weapon. These inmates can deal a significant amount of damage (especially with a high strength stat), so watch out! A Makeshift Spear can be obtained by crafting or looting other Inmates & Guards that have them.

name: Makeshift Stungun
description: The Makeshift Stungun is one of the most powerful weapons in The Escapists 2, along with the Cup of Molten Chocolate. It will K-O any inmate or guard it is used on, except for a Riot Guard, who takes 2 hits. It can only be used 5 limited times before it breaks. There are several weapons similar in function to this item. They are listed below: Cup of Molten Chocolate, a crafted weapon, lasts only one hit Cattle Prod, a crafted weapon, exclusive to Rattlesnake Springs, which is identical in function to the Makeshift Stungun Stungun, identical in function to the Makeshift Stungun. Purchasable from Inmates in U.S.S. Anomaly, found on the roof of the multiplayer-only area in H.M.P Offshore.
stats_in_2:
Damage: Highest
Speed: Medium
Range: High

name: Super Knuckle Duster
description: The Super Knuckle Duster is a weapon in The Escapists 2. You can buy the recipe from a payphone on H.M.P Offshore. This item is required in some favours.
stats_in_2:
Damage: Medium
Speed: High
Range: Low

name: Super Metal Baton
description: The Super Metal Baton is a weapon in The Escapists 2. Together with the Super Whip, it constitutes the highest tier of conventional weapons in the game. However, the Super Whip is arguably easier to craft, as it does not require you to beat up a Riot Guard.
stats_in_2:
Damage: High
Speed: Medium
Range: High

name: Cattle Prod
description: The Cattle Prod is a weapon in The Escapists 2. This weapon is very similar to the Makeshift Stungun, in that it can instantly knock out an Inmate or Guard, with the exception of SWAT Guards who require two hits. The Cattle Prod lasts as long as the Makeshift Stungun, breaking after 5 uses.
stats_in_2:
Damage: Highest
Speed: Medium
Range: High

name: Energy Sword
description: The Energy Sword is a weapon in The Escapists 2. It can only be found or crafted in U.S.S. Anomaly. It can sometimes be given when you complete a three-part Favour.
stats_in_2:
Damage: High
Speed: Low
Range: High

name: Guard Outfit
extra_info: You can also find this at the laundry job, in some prisons.
description: The Guard Outfit is an outfit worn by all Guards in each prison. Your Guard Heat will very slowly increase while wearing a Guard Outfit in sight of a guard, precisely by 3% a second in the Escapists 1 and 1% around every 2 seconds in the Escapists 2. While wearing the Guard Outfit, the following benefits are gained. If the player's heat rises above 90% (TE1) / 80% (TE2) a Guard Outfit will not prevent the player from being attacked by guards/shot by snipers. The Guard Outfit can be crafted with the following recipe: Additionally, in TE1, there are other ways to obtain it. It can be purchased or rarely found in desks. It is one of the two outfits that can be obtained by working in the Laundry. Since the Laundry job almost always has a contraband detector, the player will either need to use a Contraband Pouch or get it through by wearing it. In TE2, it can be required for the "Fashion Victim" Favour.

name: Infirmary Overalls
description: This outfit [known as the Infirmary Outfit in The Escapists 2] works like the Guard Outfit. The most important use of this outfit is its ability to give the player access to the medical storage. When wearing this, the player is able to open doors with green cross symbols, present in one Infirmary of each prison. If guards see the player with it equipped, your heat will gradually rise.

name: Cushioned Inmate Outfit
description: Reduces the amount of damage you take by 1. Not really worth making, as Duct Tape is better used in more valuable items and pillows aren't that much more common than Books, which can be used to craft the Padded Inmate Outfit, an armor item one tier stronger than Cushioned. Crafted with the following recipe: The Escapists 2:

name: Padded Inmate Outfit
description: The Padded Inmate Outfit is an improved version of the Cushioned Inmate Outfit. Although it is not the best of the improvements of the Inmate Outfit, it is a very useful and easy-to-craft item and it adds 2 defense, meaning that the enemy (regardless of Guard or Inmate) loses 2 attack when attacking you. It is succeeded by the Plated Inmate Outfit. The Escapists 2:

name: Plated Inmate Outfit
description: An upgrade to both Cushioned Inmate Outfit and Padded Inmate Outfit, the Plated Inmate Outfit gives the player +3 defence.

name: Makeshift Robot Guard Outfit
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, only in U.S.S Anomaly, acts as a Guard Outfit.
description: The Makeshift Robot Guard Outfit is one of the items that appears in The Escapists 2. It behaves like a Guard Outfit and is exclusive to U.S.S. Anomaly. Can be crafted. The components of the outfit are commonly found in desks.

name: Fake Wall Block
extra_info: use amount 20%
description: The Fake Wall Block can be used to fill in the hole left by chipping away at a wall, but it can be removed by right clicking or interacting. A Fake Wall Block has an arguably better alternative, being the Poster, which has an infinite durability but may be removed by Guards with low Opinions of you. This can be reused, however it does have a durability limit. (On mobile it can be used unlimited amount of times.) Sometimes, the wall block will get stuck and not let you retrieve it. This is a known bug. This can be crafted with the following recipe: Remember not to confuse the crafting recipe for the Fake Vent Cover for the recipe of the Fake Wall Block, as they are very similar.

name: Fake Vent Cover
extra_info: use amount 20%
description: This item is used to cover removed (unscrewed / filed) vent covers. A fake vent cover can be reused, however it has a durability limit. Every time you go through it, 20% durability is lost. If the vent in your cell isn't covered by either a real or fake vent cover, you'll be sent to solitary confinement. Crafted with the following recipe:

name: Fake Fence
extra_info: Left with 80% of durability after placement.
description: For the item in The Escapists: The Walking Dead, see Fake Fence Cover.

name: Bed Dummy
extra_info: Can be used indefinitely
description: The Bed Dummy is a usable item that is placed on the player's bed.

name: Contraband Pouch
extra_info: Has 4 uses in TE1. Has 5 uses in TE2. Does not take durability if it is the only contraband item in your inventory (TE1).
description: The Contraband Pouch is an item that allows you to carry contraband through Contraband Detectors without raising your heat. As long as you have one in your inventory, detectors won't go off. It will lose 20% durability (25% on PC) every time you pass through a Contraband Detector, even if you have no other contraband, as it is contraband itself. It will not be confiscated in the Console and Mobile versions of the first game.If you have access to a lot of Foil, it may be worthwhile to create a Durable Contraband Pouch instead; the Durable version takes 2 foil instead of 1 to craft, but lasts longer. In The Escapists 2, the Contraband Pouch is used in crafting the Durable Contraband Pouch, but more usable durability can be obtained if one upgrades the Contraband Pouch to its durable variant when it has only one use left.

name: Durable Contraband Pouch
extra_info: Has 7 uses in TE1. Has 10 uses in TE2. Does not work on console (TE1), uses a Contraband Pouch instead of one of the Foils in TE2. Does not take durability if it is the only contraband item in your inventory (TE1).
description: The Durable Contraband Pouch is an item that conceals Contraband in your inventory from Contraband Detectors. It will lose 15% durability every time you pass through a Contraband Detector with contraband items other than the pouch itself. It is good for 7 uses. In The Escapists 2, the Pouch will lose durability even if you have no other contraband (the Pouch itself is contraband) and loses only 10% durability per use. The Contraband Pouch can be found in a prisoner stash or by crafting the following items:  In The Escapists 2, the Durable Contraband Pouch is crafted as follows:

name: Poster
extra_info: Has 5 uses in TE2 but can be used indefinitely in TE1.
description: The Poster is a decorative item that can take the place of a wall to disguise what is on the other side. It serves the same purpose as the Fake Wall Block. It cannot be used on cut fences.

name: ID Papers
extra_info: Jungle Compound Exclusive. Only in TE1.
description: The ID Papers can be given to the checkpoint at the Jungle Compound to complete the escape.

name: Zipline Hook
extra_info: Does not work in console, exclusive to TE1.
description: The Zipline Hook is a tool used on a zipline. They can be found in the 0.9 and above prisons. (HMP-Irongate, Paris Central Pen, Camp Epsilon, etc.)

name: Grapple Head
extra_info: Can be used as a Weapon in TE2
description: The Grapple Head is used as a component of the grappling hook.

name: Grappling Hook
extra_info: Has ∞ uses. Can be used as a Weapon in TE2 and be used to climb 1 floor tall walls.
description: The Grappling Hook is an item used to get over walls. It can only be used to climb over walls on roofs, walls on ground level are too tall. It degrades 20% per use and requires 90 intellect to craft. On console versions, it is called the Grapple Hook instead, and degrades 35% per use. On mobile versions, however, the Grappling Hook does not degrade at all. In The Escapists 2, the Grappling Hook does not degrade, and can be used on ground level, but can only ascend one floor at a time. Certain areas cannot be grappled to, while others can - some roofs often have only a single valid tile for grappling onto. Can be crafted with the following recipe:

name: Sheet Rope
extra_info: Has 2 uses in TE1.
description: Used to descend from rooftops by left clicking the edging that surrounds the rooftop. (Note that you do not actually click in any of the spaces between the edging). Degrades by 50% each use. In The Escapists 2, the Sheet Rope is used to descend 2 floors, no matter if it is the roof or not, and never degrades. In both games, they have the same function as Length of Rope, although they can not tie Inmates or Guards down. It can be only be crafted, using the following recipe: Sheet rope does not degrade, just like the Grappling Hook.

name: Cooked Food
extra_info: Exclusive to TE1.
description: Cooked Food is a consumable item. When used, it reduces the player's Fatigue by 10. It can also be used as a perfect gift for other inmates to make them have a better opinion of you since it is somewhat easy to obtain.

name: Candle (Escapists 1)
extra_info: Different recipe in TE2.
description: The Candle is used to light up tunnels underground by the player. The candle may also be requested from inmates in favours. You could also give it to fellow inmates to raise their opinion of you. It does not appear to affect light in The Escapists 2, meaning its only use is as a favor item.

name: Candle (Escapists 2)
extra_info: Different recipe in TE1.
description: The Candle is used to light up tunnels underground by the player. The candle may also be requested from inmates in favours. You could also give it to fellow inmates to raise their opinion of you. It does not appear to affect light in The Escapists 2, meaning its only use is as a favor item.

name: Paper Mache
description: Paper Mache is created through crafting and is used to craft other items. Can only be crafted.

name: Molten Plastic
description: Molten Plastic is a contraband item in The Escapists, used to create a Plastic Key. On the console/Mobile Versions it is not a contraband item. In The Escapists 2, it is also used to create the Fake Keycards.

name: Plastic Key (Color)
description: Plastic Keys are items in The Escapists which, like the Key, can be used to open a certain type door depending on the key type. The purpose of Plastic Keys is for the Player to be able to obtain a key without being sent to solitary (TE1) or initiating lockdown (TE2).

name: Key Mold (Color)
description: Key Moulds are crafted items which allow you to make a plastic copy of normal colored Keys carried by specific Guards.

name: Keycard Mould (Color)
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2.
description: Used to craft Fake Keycards. To make a Fake Keycard, make this first. Just like with a normal Key Mold, you need to put the keycard back into the Guard's inventory after the mold is made, to avoid a lockdown.

name: Fake Keycards (Color)
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, used to open up multiplayer only areas.
description: Not to be confused with Keycard.

name: Wad of Putty
description: This can be used to create a Key Mould This item is contraband on the PC version of The Escapists. The Console and Mobile versions of The Escapists and The Escapists 2 have this as non-contraband, and won't be confiscated. Obtained by finding it in desks , buying it off others or crafting it.

name: Timber Brace (Escapists 1)
extra_info: Different recipe in TE2.
description: The Timber Brace is used to support your underground tunnel when it grows larger. If you do not support your tunnel, you cannot dig very far (you are unable to dig if the tunnel has extended too long without a Timber Brace installed). It can be used as a weapon in The Escapists 2.

name: Timber Brace (Escapists 2)
extra_info: Different recipe in TE1.
description: The Timber Brace is used to support your underground tunnel when it grows larger. If you do not support your tunnel, you cannot dig very far (you are unable to dig if the tunnel has extended too long without a Timber Brace installed). It can be used as a weapon in The Escapists 2.

name: Unvarnished Chair
description: The Unvarnished Chair is a craftable item using 3 Timber. This requires at least 30 Intelligence in order to craft.

name: Sail
extra_info: Only in HMP-Irongate, exclusive to TE1.
description: The Sail is a crafting item exclusive to the Escapists used to craft a Makeshift Raft. It is not contraband on console.

name: Raft Base
extra_info: Only in HMP-Irongate, exclusive to TE1
description: The Raft Base is essential to escape HMP-Irongate because you need it to craft the Makeshift Raft, which lets you sail over the water, leading to your escape.

name: Makeshift Raft
extra_info: Only in HMP-Irongate, exclusive to TE1.
description: The Makeshift Raft is used to escape HMP-Irongate, in which you use it at the border of the island to sail over the water.

name: Stinger Strip
extra_info: Exclusive to TE1.
description: The Stinger Strip is used to temporarily disable the Jeep patrol around the exterior of Jungle Compound and San Pancho, though it is useless in other prisons due to the lack of jeeps.

name: Crate Base
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in Center Perks 2.0.
description: The Crate Base is an item in The Escapists 2. It's a required item in the "Last Post" escape in Center Perks 2.0 prison.

name: Cup of Tea
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2.
description: The Cup of Tea is an item in The Escapists 2.

name: Glider Skin
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in K.A.P.O.W Camp.
description: Used as the last part of the "Glide To Victory" escape way from the K.A.P.O.W Camp prison. Can be put on the plane construction area, which is located on the 3-rd floor of the Eastern building after both Halves Frames of Glider are already placed here.

name: Manicure Kit
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in Center Perks 2.0, Rattlesnake Springs and Fort Tundra.
description: Not to be confused with Pedicure Kit, an item in The Escapists.

name: Makeshift Harness
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in Air Force Con
description: Used as a part of the "Plane Crazy" escape way from the Air Force Con and used to craft Parachute.

name: Makeshift Ladder
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2 and TE:WD.
description: The Makeshift Ladder is an item in The Escapists: The Walking Dead and The Escapists 2. The Makeshift Ladder is a tool for entering and reentering vents above you. Placing the Makeshift Ladder on a tile will allow you to stand on it in a similar manner to a desk. This allows you to see the ventilation system, unscrew/cut Vent Covers, and enter vents. The Escapists 2 The Escapists: The Walking Dead

name: Readied Fishing Rod
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in H.M.P Offshore.
description: The Readied Fishing Rod is an item needed to escape the H.M.P Offshore Prison's "Swimming with dolphins" escape.

name: Parachute
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in Air Force Con.
description: The Parachute is used as part of the "Plane Crazy" escape method from Air Force Con in The Escapists 2.

name: Potted Plant
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2.
description: The Potted Plant is a consumable item in The Escapists 2.

name: Pretend Flower
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2.
description: The Pretend Flower is sometimes requested in favors. The Pretend Flower can be crafted.

name: Pretend Carrot
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in Cougar Creek Railroad.
description: A Pretend Carrot is an item used for the "My Little Phoney" escape in the Cougar Creek Railroad prison and the "Top of the Naughty List" escape in the Santa's Shakedown prison in The Escapists 2. A Pretend Carrot can only be crafted.

name: Readied Paint Brush
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2.
description: The Readied Paint Brush is used in the Painting job in The Escapists 2.

name: Visitors Kit
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2.
description: The Visitors Kit is an item in The Escapists 2. It is a gifting item.

name: Breathing Mask
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in Rattlesnake Springs and H.M.P Offshore.
description: The Breathing Mask is an item in The Escapists 2. Used as a part of the "Take Out The Trash" escape way from the Rattlesnake Springs prison, and also the "Trash Talk" escape from H.M.P. Offshore. Can be used to craft Breathable Trash Bag.

name: Framed Photo
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2.
description: The Framed Photo is an item in The Escapists 2. It is currently unknown what purpose it serves. In Snow Way Out, the Framed Photo is used as part of a unique Favour, however the player need not craft it for the favor.

name: Glue Readied Furniture
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2.
description: The Glue Readied Furniture is an item in The Escapists 2. It is used in the Woodwork Job, where it must be placed in a machine to produce Finished Furniture. The Glue Readied Furniture is crafted.

name: Makeshift Rocket Thruster
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in K.A.P.O.W Camp.
description: Used as the last part of the the "Speedy McQueen" escape way from the K.A.P.O.W Camp prison. Can be used on motorbike, which is located in the garage on the Southern part of the prison.

name: Music Washboard
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2.
description: The Music Washboard is a non-contraband item in The Escapists 2. Its main purpose is to complete favours. The music washboard is an item required for the accomplishment of the favours "The Conductor" and "Crafty!". When the favour "The Conductor" is accepted, it can be found in a certain inmate desk. It can also be crafted.

name: Uncooked Pie
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2.
description: The Uncooked Pie is an item in The Escapists 2.

name: Cooked Pie
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2.
description: The Cooked Pie is an item in The Escapists 2.

name: Burnt Pie
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2.
description: The Burnt Pie is an item in The Escapists 2. The Burnt Pie can be obtained by placing an Uncooked Pie in the oven in the Kitchen Job. The oven will display a bar with three segments, blue, green and red. An indicator moves slowly from left (blue) to right (red). Interacting while the indicator is in the red will yield a Burnt Pie, while blue yields Uncooked Pie and green yields Cooked Pie. The Burnt Pie is a consumable item. It restores 30 Health when consumed.

name: Unglued Furniture
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2.
description: The Unglued Furniture is an item in The Escapists 2. Despite it being crafted with two Timber, it is not contraband. The Unglued Furniture is used to craft Glue Readied Furniture as part of the Woodwork Job. You are only able to obtain this item through crafting.

name: Breathable Trash Bag
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in Rattlesnake Springs and H.M.P Offshore
description: Used as the last part of the "Take Out The Trash" escape method from the Rattlesnake Springs, and H.M.P Offshore's "Trash Talk" escape. It can be used when both players have it and both are nearby the trash bin.

name: Crate Casing
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in Center Perks 2.0.
description: Used as a part of the "Last Post" escape way from the Center Perks 2.0. Can be put on construct crate in the East side room of the prison.

name: Crate Top
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in Center Perks 2.0.
description: Used as a part of the "Last Post" escape way from the Center Perks 2.0. Can be put on construct crate in the East side room of the prison after the Crate Casing is already placed here.

name: Crossbow Body
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in Rattlesnake Springs.
description: Used as a part of "Zip It Up" escape way and used to craft Crossbow.

name: Crossbow Lathe
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in Rattlesnake Springs.
description: Used as a part of "Zip It Up" escape way and used to craft Crossbow.

name: Fake Audio Equipment
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in Center Perks 2.0
description: Can be used to escape from the Center Perks 2.0 in combination with Civilian Outfit. Radio Receiver can be found in the desk where film crew is located.

name: Gun Making Kit
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in H.M.S Orca, H.M.P Offshore and The Glorious Regime
description: A Gun Making Kit is an item in The Escapists 2. The Gun Making Kit can only be crafted in H.M.S Orca and The Glorious Regime.

name: Half Frame of Glider
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in K.A.P.O.W Camp.
description: Used as a part of the "Glide To Victory" escape way from the K.A.P.O.W Camp prison. Can be put on the plane construction area, which is located on the 3-rd floor of the Eastern building.

name: Heart Rate Slower
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in The Glorious Regime
description: The Heart Rate Slower is an item from the DLC prison The Glorious Regime in The Escapists 2. It is required for the singleplayer-only escape.

name: Beautiful Painting
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2.
description: The Beautiful Painting is an item in The Escapists 2. It is used solely for Favours. The Beautiful Painting is crafted, but it can also sometimes be found on knocked-out Inmates in Center Perks 2.0.

name: Cake
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2.
description: The Cake is an item in The Escapists 2.

name: Energy Module
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2.
description: Mostly used to craft powerful weapons such as the Makeshift Stungun or Super Metal Baton. Also used for escaping from the Area 17 using "Alien Technology" method, or Air Force Con using the “Passport to Freedom” method. Two Energy Modules can be used to disable the force field to reach the Jet Pack in U.S.S. Anomaly. Used in:

name: Escapists Figurine
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2.
description: The Escapists Figurine is an item in The Escapists 2. It has no practical purpose, except as a gift for other Inmates or Guards. When offered to another character, their Opinion of you will increase by 30, the highest positive change in opinion of any item in the game [verify].

name: Machine Ready Shoe
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2.
description: The Machine Ready Shoe is an item in The Escapists 2. The Machine Ready Shoe is used in the Shoe Making job. Once crafted, it must be placed into a machine to create a Ready Shoe.

name: Makeshift Breathing Apparatus
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in H.M.S Orca
description: A Makeshift Breathing Apparatus is an item used to escape the H.M.S. Orca in The Escapists 2. A Makeshift Breathing Apparatus can only be crafted.

name: Moulded Gun
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in H.M.S Orca, H.M.P Offshore and The Glorious Regime.
description: A Moulded Gun is an item in The Escapists 2. A Moulded Gun can only be crafted.

name: Pair of Shoes
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2.
description: The Pair of Shoes are an item in The Escapists 2. They are made from 2 Ready Shoes.

name: Security Pass
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in Area 17.
description: Used as a part of the "I'm only human..." escape way from the Area 17 prison.

name: Complete Crossbow
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in Rattlesnake Springs.
description: Used as key part of "Zip It Up" escape way from the Rattlesnake Springs. Can only be obtained through crafting.

name: Fake Gun
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in H.M.S Orca, H.M.P Offshore and The Glorious Regime.
description: A Fake Gun is an item used to escape the H.M.S. Orca and The Glorious Regime in The Escapists 2. A Fake Gun can only be crafted.

name: Fishing Rod
extra_info: Exclusive to TE2, found in H.M.P Offshore.
description: Used as a part of "Swimming With Dolphins" escape way and used to craft Readied Fishing Rod with a Juicy Worm.

name: Makeshift Tank Turret
description: The first part of the tank in the Escape Team map. Required for escape.

name: Makeshift Tank Barrel
description: Needed for escaping the Escape Team map.

name: Makeshift Tank Firing Base
description: Needed to escape the Escape Team Prison

name: Makeshift Explosive Round
description: The second part of the tank in the Escape Team map. Required for escape.

name: Explosive Compound
description: Needed for escaping the Escape Team prison

name: Explosive Mix
description: Needed to craft the Makeshift Explosive Round which is required to escape Escape Team.

name: Makeshift Fuse
description: Needed for escaping the Escape Team map. When used, it immediately fires the tank.

name: Voice Recording
description: The Voice Recording is an item exclusive to the Duct Tapes Are Forever DLC prison. It is created by combining Memoir Tapes with a Tape Player. It is then put into the middle terminal around the rocket while escaping.

name: Fake Fingerprint
description: The Fake Fingerprint is an item exclusive to the Duct Tapes Are Forever DLC prison. It is created by combining a Weak Fingerprint with Blue Putty. It is then put into the right terminal around the rocket while escaping.

name: Weak Fingerprint
description: The Weak Fingerprint is an item exclusive to the Duct Tapes Are Forever DLC prison. It is created by combining Dirty Glass with a Tub of Talcum Powder and some Sticky Tape . It is used to craft the Fake Fingerprint, which is required to escape.

name: Metal Rimmed Hat
description: The Metal Rimmed Hat is an exclusive weapon to the Duct Tapes Are Forever DLC prison.

name: Flamethrower
description: The Flamethrower is a Duct Tapes Are Forever exclusive item. Like the Cup of Molten Chocolate and the Bomb Surprise, it can knock out a guard or inmate instantly. Unlike the other instant KO items from Duct Tapes Are Forever, this item can be crafted.

name: Presents
description: Presents are an exclusive item to the Santa's Sweatshop DLC prison. It is the third item that is put on the tree before escaping. This item is required to escape Santa's Sweatshop.

name: Presents
description: Presents are an exclusive item to the Santa's Sweatshop DLC prison. It is the third item that is put on the tree before escaping. This item is required to escape Santa's Sweatshop.

name: Presents
description: Presents are an exclusive item to the Santa's Sweatshop DLC prison. It is the third item that is put on the tree before escaping. This item is required to escape Santa's Sweatshop.

name: Presents
description: Presents are an exclusive item to the Santa's Sweatshop DLC prison. It is the third item that is put on the tree before escaping. This item is required to escape Santa's Sweatshop.

name: Tinsel
description: Tinsel is an exclusive item to the Santa's Sweatshop DLC prison. It is the first item that is put on the tree before escaping. This item is required to escape Santa's Sweatshop.

name: Fairy Lights
description: The Fairy Lights are an exclusive item to the Santa's Sweatshop DLC prison. The Fairy Lights is the second item that you need to put on the tree before escaping. This item is required to escape Santa's Sweatshop.

name: Thruster
description: The Thruster is one the requirements to escape Jingle Cells.

name: Makeshift Compass
description: Needed to work the sleigh on the Jingle Cells map and is required to escape.

name: Navigation Lighting
description: Needed to escape the Jingle Cells Prison.

name: Magnetized Needle
description: Needed to craft the Makeshift Compass.

name: Bowl of Water
description: Needed to craft the required item to escape the Jingle Cells prison.

name: High Beam Flashlight
description: Needed to craft the Navigation Lighting which is required to escape the Jingle Cells prison.

name: Juicy Cooked Carrots
extra_info: Kitchen job is required
description: It is used to escape the Jingle Cells prison after you use the Navigation Lighting, Makeshift Compass, and Thruster.
